{"blocks":[{"key":"dkul9","text":"Turn on the fluorescent Lightsource","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7afef","text":"Press the \"LAMP ON\" icon on the desktop of the computer","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ag2l","text":"If the lamp doesnt start, ensure it is not in \"Cooling Mode\" by checking the Yellow LED isnt illuminated. {"blocks":[{"key":"2m2jh","text":"Setting up Laser lines","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6v07d","text":"Adding a laser line to your acquisition can be done by selecting either the diode buttons (1) or the \"+\" button (2) for WLL lines.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9akv","text":"To engage the laser, the small tick box next to the wavelength indicator must be selected","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt25n","text":"To open the shutter on the relevant laser, the small red circle must be selected (3). NOTE when laser power is se above 0% and all the shutters are open, the lightpath will change from white to orange.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d99oi","text":"When using the WLL, specific notch filters (4) exist for common lines.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cm2u","text":"Move the slider up to increase laser power (5)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4dkp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dkv7i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":138,"id":436318,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"c3bgk\",\"text\":\"LAS X laser configuration panel\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdabm7s7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkc8bm7s7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkc9bm7s7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkc7bm7s7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7c3sr","text":"Main Acquisition Parameters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bthjp","text":"In the top left hand corner of the LAS X program window is the main control panel for setting up acquisition parameters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mapm","text":"Select the type of acquisition you wish to capture from the drop down (1). NOTE for a normal 3D acquisition select XYZ, other modes include time (t) or excitation wavelength (λ) or detection wavelength (Λ)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7u2df","text":"If you require 'complex' imaging modes select one of them using the buttons (2). These include Navigator, FALCON, Autofocus and Sequential Scan.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jdcf","text":"Ensure you final image has enough pixels for Nyquist by clicking the symbol (3) to automatically calculate it for you. Alternatively, manually chose a relevant image size from the dropdown.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bamiu","text":"Scan speed is measured in Hz in LAS X. Meaning the number displayed is the 'number of lines per second' (eg this image of 512 lines @ 400Hz would take ~1.2s to acquire.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd9nq","text":"Depending on your imaging setup you may wish to acquire bidirectionally. The toggle (4) allows you to turn this feature on. (Note using bidirectional scanning will decrease your acquisition time by half).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cdps","text":"The field of view can be zoomed in (5) by adjusting the slider or by selecting \"ON/OFF\" toggle and drawing a ROI over the image area you wish to acquire.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9djd","text":"TO reduce noise, and/or increase signal in your images you may need to perform either averaging or accumulations (6). These can be done on either the line level or frame level. Note you can only perform an average OR accumulation for each acquisition, you can for example do 2 line averages and 3 frame accumulations.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ak9h","text":"Ensure the pinhole is set to 1AU for confocal imaging.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e85rl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q0cn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b3nem","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":708,"id":436322,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"rhhe\",\"text\":\"LAS X Acquisition settings\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdebm7s7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdcbm7s7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkddbm7s7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdbbm7s7.webp","width":405}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87d7q","text":"Detector Settings \u0026 Adjustments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lbro","text":"Generally, detector ranges should not need to change between sequences as this is a slow process. For example, for the following setup, detectors are set to a sample containing DAPI, Alexa488 and Alexa568. In this scenario all 3 dyes will be imaged at the same time, (which may result in cross-talk \u0026 bleedthrough). To overcome this, simply duplicate the sequence and turn off PMT2 \u0026 488 laser on one sequence, and HyD1 \u0026 HyD3 and the 405 \u0026 561nm lasers on the alternate sequence.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nebh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8gv0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fvfn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oi0g","text":"Setting up this imaging experiment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90ou0","text":"Working from left to right (in emission wavelength) and top to bottom (in detector number) turn on HyD1 and set its look up table to be blue.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a131","text":"On the right hand side of the detector window, set the dye to be DAPI","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjm76","text":"Adjust the detector range for HyD1 to cover most of the DAPI emmision curve shown above (e.g. 415-478nm) and set a gain of 100","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nrd8","text":"Turn on PMT2 and set its look up table to be green and set its dye reference to be Alexa488","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"budjp","text":"Adjust the detector range for PMT2 to cover most of the emission curve shown above (e.g. 498-551nm) and set a gain of 700.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fppg","text":"Turn on HyD3 and set its look up table to be red and set its dye reference to be Alexa568","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fgo5","text":"Adjust the detector range for HyD3 to cover most of the emission curve shown above (e.g. 571-747nm) and set a gain of 100.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25g4n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pmtr","text":"Note: For this setup lasers have been set for 405nm, 488nm and 561nm. Leave 10nm either side of the laser for all detectors. NEVER place a laser line over a detector range.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":102}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu1g8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cufq","text":"Note: HyD1 \u0026 HyD3 are gated detectors. Gating the detectors will remove autofluorescence and laser reflection/scattering. When in use select the relevant laserline from the WLL in the dropdown on the right hand side.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tsdk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"703n2","text":"Note: Gain may need to be adjusted for either HyD or PMT detectors. If you find you require high laser power (\u003e30%) and HyD gain \u003e400, or PMT gain \u003e1000 talk to microscopy facility staff.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etl1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":220,"id":436326,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9058t\",\"text\":\"Example 3 colour detector settings.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdibm7s7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdgbm7s7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdhbm7s7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdfbm7s7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mtp","text":"Image Window Controls","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43fs9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ad2dq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"degvh","text":"Note: In LAS X the toggle buttons display what you are ‘on’ now, not what you would like to do. Ie above on the right hand side the second button displays multi-channel display mode, select this to change to overlay window mode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6buee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mptm","text":"Note: When adjusting brightness scale select the window first to choose the active channel to change.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcs94","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs54k","text":"Note: If you need to change the LUT of your channel after acquisition right-click on the displayed LUT on the left hand side of the image display window.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":586.3272727272728,"id":436330,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdnbm7s7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdkbm7s7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdmbm7s7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdjbm7s7.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"27la5","text":"Using Range Indicator to correctly set up your channels","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3ql2","text":"In order to correctly set up you image acquisition parameters the range indicator LUT is a tool which should be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3uj20","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8iho","text":"The LUT ranges from Green \u003e Black \u003e Red \u003e Orange \u003e White \u003e Blue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dksf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhdnj","text":"With Green = 0, and Blue = 255 (saturated)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nhco","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evohr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f03in","text":"Note: To access this look-up-table select the LUT tool from the top left button in the image control panel above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":306,"id":436334,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdsbm7s7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdqbm7s7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdrbm7s7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdpbm7s7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b599f","text":"Setting up multiple sequences","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3radc","text":"Turn on sequential scanning mode by selecting \"SEQ\" at the top of the acquisition panel.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4utu","text":"Using Seq.1 set up your lasers and detector ranges for all channels","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cigqr","text":"Press the \"+\" button in the Sequential Scan tool lines.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qgtl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l1bo","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"c2k9c","text":"Leica Dye Assistant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tes5","text":"Similar to other venders’ solutions, Leica has a wizard for automatically configuring the light path for you, called Dye Assistant. It is not as thorough, nor as complex as other solutions so use it carefully!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26rd4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r71f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3q3r4","text":"Select the Dye Assistant icon from the Tools panel (Middle of the lightpath panel)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8isq","text":"Add your labels using the \"+\" symbol. NOTE if your label isnt in the database please select a simialr dye or speak to facility staff.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73d3e","text":"Once you have selected your dyes you can indicate whether you need a HyD or PMT or either. Remember a HyD is more sensitive so is suitable for dimmer dyes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rh7o","text":"Next select one fo the options generated by selecting Apply.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch6pl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eak3r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"et6pe","text":"Remember it is important to reduce crosstalk as much as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5brj0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46bl0","text":"The least number of sequences is generally the fastest during your capture, but this option may result in high levels of crosstalk. If more than one sequence is required (most often the case) choosing a “Line Sequential” option will generally be faster than “Frame Sequential.” To increase signal, detectors can be set to capture more of the emission range, however these adjustments are slow, and can only be made between frames, during line sequences, detector positions cannot be changed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":100,"id":436346,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkabbm7s7.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkd4bm7s7.jpg","type":1,"webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkd3bm7s7.webp","width":100}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":730,"id":436342,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkd2bm7s7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdybm7s7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdzbm7s7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pkdxbm7s7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5kur","text":"Setting up Z-stacks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35q1k","text":"Ensure you have an acquisition setting chosen that includes Z dimension","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jhtr","text":"Use the Z-drive (Galvonic Stage) controls on the USB controller to navigate to the top or bottom of the sample and select begin.
